title: Cameron Barrett’s CV
text:
BYU–Idaho Student,

bar21088@byui.edu | LinkedIn



Financial Economics student focused on investment banking, valuation, and applied financial analytics.



Sep 2023 – Present Brigham Young University–Idaho, Rexburg, ID
Bachelor of Science in Financial Economics (Minor: Mathematics)
- Scholarship: BYU–Idaho Grant
- GPA: 3.98 / 4.00
- CFA Level I Candidate (Exam: Aug 2025)



Sep 2025 – Present Co-President, Investment Banking Society, BYU–Idaho, Rexburg, ID
- Co-founded the Investment Banking Society and co-established governance, structure, and curriculum
- Launched and managed the club Instagram account, expanding on-campus reach to 250+ students
- Taught discounted cash flow modeling and financial statement analysis in Excel using Wall Street Prep
- Organized a campus info session with Lazard (NYC), coordinating outreach, logistics, and promotion to expand recruiting access



Programming & Analysis: Python, R Markdown, SQL, Excel, Mathematica
Financial Tools: Bloomberg Terminal, Thinkorswim, Trade Ideas, TradingView
Data Skills: Financial Statement Analysis, Regression Analysis, Quantitative Analysis, Bond Pricing Models



Jan 2025 – Present Teacher Assistant and Lab Tutor, BYU–Idaho Economics & Math Departments, Rexburg, ID
- Created grading keys and detailed rubrics for Financial Analytics assignments; reduced inconsistencies by 15% and improved transparency across 200+ submissions/semester
- Taught financial analytics to 8–10 students per session; built Excel/R labs, walkthroughs, and exam-prep guides that improved test scores and pass rates
- Built dynamic Excel models (amortization, bond pricing, multi-scenario risk) and embedded them into assignments to reinforce real-world application



Jan 2025 – Jul 2025 Financial Analytics / Investment Society Projects
- Built an Excel yield-curve dashboard tracking the 3M–10Y U.S. Treasury spread using Bloomberg recession data and the U.S. federal funds rate
- Evaluated risk for a basket of equities using statistical metrics in Excel; highlights: Nvidia top risk factor ranking (56.3% ann; 0.97 CoV), Broadcom left-tail (−27.8 skew; 11.8 kurt), Micron (11.1% ann; 4.33 CoV)
- Analyzed Palantir Technologies (PLTR) fundamentals; produced a 12-month price target and Hold recommendation using ratios and a 5-year DCF forecast
- Modeled CAPM in Excel by regressing BlackRock (BLK) vs S&P 500/DJIA/NASDAQ to estimate β and required return; validated results with three sources (range 1.16–1.39) to inform allocation decisions
